bill_title: create a tax relief fund and to dedicate certain sales and use tax revenue received by the state through the Streamlined Sales and Use Tax Agreement.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to create a tax relief fund and to dedicate certain sales and use tax revenue received by the state through the Streamlined Sales and Use Tax Agreement. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. There is hereby created in the state treasury the tax relief fund. The revenue collected pursuant to section 2 of this Act shall be deposited in the tax relief fund for the purpose of reducing the rate of taxation or exempting taxes imposed by the state. The reduction or exemption in taxation shall be based on the amount of revenue deposited in the tax relief fund during the previous fiscal year and the expectation that a similar amount of revenue shall be received annually thereon. The commissioner of finance and management may transfer moneys available from the tax relief fund to the general fund as necessary to replace the revenue previously received from the taxes that were either exempted or reduced or both. The fund shall be invested as provided by law, and the interest earned shall be credited to the fund. Section 2. The additional net revenue received by the state, which would otherwise not have been received by the state, except for the implementation of the provisions of the Streamlined Sales and Use Tax Agreement on sales taxes imposed by chapter 10-45 and use taxes imposed by chapter 10-46, shall be deposited in the tax relief created pursuant to section 1 of this Act. However, an amount equal to the additional net revenue received by the state in fiscal year 2006, which would otherwise not have been received by the state except for the implementation of the provisions of the Streamlined Sales and Use Tax Agreement on sales taxes imposed by chapter 10-45 and use taxes imposed by chapter 10-46, shall be annually deposited in the general fund.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to create a tax relief fund and to dedicate certain sales and use tax revenue received by the state through the Streamlined Sales and Use Tax Agreement. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. There is hereby created in the state treasury the tax relief fund. The revenue collected pursuant to section 2 of this Act shall be deposited in the tax relief fund for the purpose of reducing the rate of taxation or reducing property taxes. The fund shall be invested as provided by law, and the interest earned shall be credited to the fund. The Legislature may not appropriate any money from the tax relief fund until the second fiscal year after Congress approves legislation giving states the authority to require retailers to collect South Dakota's sales and use tax. Section 2. The additional net revenue received by the state from voluntary retail licensees shall be deposited in the tax relief fund created pursuant to section 1 of this Act. For the purposes of this Act, a voluntary retail licensee is any person licensed through the Streamlined Sales and Use Tax Agreement to remit sales and use tax pursuant to chapters 10-45 and 10-46 who does not otherwise have a legal obligation to remit such taxes.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to create a tax relief fund and to dedicate certain sales and use tax revenue received by the state through the Streamlined Sales and Use Tax Agreement and to provide compensation to certain retailers for collecting and remitting the sales tax. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. There is hereby created in the state treasury the tax relief fund. The revenue collected pursuant to section 2 of this Act shall be deposited in the tax relief fund for the purpose of reducing the rate of taxation or reducing property taxes. When the balance in the fund exceeds ten million dollars, a collection allowance established pursuant to section 3 of this Act shall become effective the following July first. The fund shall be invested as provided by law, and the interest earned shall be credited to the fund. The Legislature may not appropriate any money from the tax relief fund until the second fiscal year after Congress approves legislation giving states the authority to require retailers to collect South Dakota's sales and use tax. Section 2. The additional net revenue received by the state from voluntary retail licensees shall be deposited in the tax relief fund created pursuant to section 1 of this Act. For the purposes of this Act, a voluntary retail licensee is any person licensed through the Streamlined Sales and Use Tax Agreement to remit sales and use tax pursuant to chapters 10-45 and 10-46 who does not otherwise have a legal obligation to remit such taxes. Section 3. Any person required to file a return and remit the tax imposed by chapter 10-45 on a monthly basis and who timely files the return and pays the tax is allowed, as compensation for the expense of collecting and paying the tax monthly, a credit equal to one and one-half percent of the gross amount of the tax due. However, the credit may not exceed seventy dollars per month.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to create a tax relief fund and to dedicate certain sales and use tax revenue received by the state through the Streamlined Sales and Use Tax Agreement. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. There is hereby created in the state treasury the tax relief fund. The revenue collected pursuant to section 2 of this Act shall be deposited in the tax relief fund for the purpose of reducing the rate of taxation or reducing property taxes. The fund shall be invested as provided by law, and the interest earned shall be credited to the fund. The Legislature may not appropriate any money from the tax relief fund until the second fiscal year after Congress approves legislation giving states the authority to require retailers to collect South Dakota's sales and use tax. Section 2. The additional net revenue received by the state from voluntary retail licensees shall be deposited in the tax relief fund created pursuant to section 1 of this Act. For the purposes of this Act, a voluntary retail licensee is any person licensed through the Streamlined Sales and Use Tax Agreement to remit sales and use tax pursuant to chapters 10-45 and 10-46 who does not otherwise have a legal obligation to remit such taxes.
